page.title: 02LAUDER COLLEGE- CROSSGATES
page.content: Lauder Technical College was originally opened in the New Row, Dunfermline on the 10th of October 1899.In 1976 it combined with three other colleges: Fod Nursing College, Cowdenbeath Mining College and the college already at Halbeath. The college was named after George Lauder, The Uncle of Andrew Carnegie. Carnegie donated Â£13,000 to the building of the original college. There are 4000 students taught by 175 teachers at present. The students are on day release, full time or night courses. Some of the courses taken are: Engineering, Building, Catering, Nursing, Business Studies, Electronics and Computing. General or specialised courses, 0'Grades, A'Levels or Pitman certificates can be gained at the college.
